item.title: Report E-2024060121
item.description:
Report E-2024060121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately 1 gallon of UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquids, n.o.s. (Cyclohexanone, Ethyl Lactate), 3, II released from a tanker truck dome lid, migrated through the drain line and impacted asphalt beneath the trailer when the vehicle parked, pending receipt by the Veolia TSDF in Henderson, CO. The cleanup was conducted in-house. There were no employee exposures or injuries.

item.title: Report E-2024060078
item.description:
Report E-2024060078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2734 Tri-Act 1825 release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 1’ area of the wood trailer floor and tote body due to the cap coming off in transit. The cap was re-secured to the tote. The impacted tote and trailer floor were cleaned with pads and simple green. The impacted rags and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
